website_summaries.verdict: Reusable training pants from a company that focuses on quality and child safety as well as sustainability.
pros: Material is thin, yet it catches at least some leaks
Absorbent core made from plant-based materials
cons: Sizes run large, but notably, size only goes up to 4T/5T

customer_reviews.title: Seriously?! What are they thinking?
customer_reviews.text: Ok look at the photo I uploaded.... Look at this training underwear compared to a Huggies Easy Ups. The Honest Company undies are built to fit an elephant! No elastic in the sides so the sides can't conform or shape to your kid's hips. They just fall off!! The butt and crotch fits but the waist is like women's size Large underwear??! WTH! Doesn't even make sense.
customer_reviews.author: VMH

customer_reviews.title: These run huge.
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of $40 for me. I got the box in the mail today and promptly opened it since we had just ran out of the other ones we had... these are huge. The 2t-3t in this brand is bigger than a 4t-5t of all the other brands we've tried. I've included pictures for reference. The Honest one is the 2t-3t purchased for my 18 month old and is compared to a Parents' Choice 4t-5t leftover from her brother's potty training days. I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to be more environmentally friendly but these are just creating more laundry. My 3 year old wears these and if he has them on for his nap, he's soaked when he wakes up. I am also going to write Honest company a review since there is a 100% guarantee with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Buss

customer_reviews.title: Awesome “pull-ups”
customer_reviews.text: Love love love Honest diapers and decided to try their training pants as well. They are totally worth it. They fit nicely and are so soft! My son loved the dinosaur print and they have good absorbency. I think the diapers are more absorbent but these are still pretty good. These end up being cheaper then the Honest diapers but since they don’t seem to absorb as much, I think it’s only fair....
customer_reviews.author: Camila Ramires Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Bum Burn!!  Beware
customer_reviews.text: I liked that these didn't have velcro strips on the sides and the design was cute, but holy cow did they give my little guy the worst bum rash he's ever had. After two days I had to change brands because it was just getting worse even with him not wearing them most of the day. He's never reacted to diapers like this before and he peed through them several times when he normally never soaks a diaper with one bladder release. So not worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Clauson

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the newer style
customer_reviews.text: Update: Changed my original review from 3 stars to 5. The newer design is fitted much better. These ones are ok. However, I like the fit of the newer style better. These ones are a little loose on my 2 year old. But she hasn’t had any leaks in them. A pack lasts us about two weeks since she only wears one at nap time and bedtime.
customer_reviews.author: Blackwood789

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Friendly and Mama Approved
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about Honest Diapers, as I've read mixed reviews about absorbency. However, I chose these bc the ETA for the delivery was the quickest out of all the other pull-ups. Quarantine = beggers can't be choosy. I was pleasantly surprised. The diapers are incredibly soft, my little one could easily pull them up, they stayed on - no slippage - and she easily removed when sitting on the potty. Best of all, super leak proof and absorbent. She slept in them overnight and NO LEAKS even with a heavy pee. It's the small things in life that make the biggest difference. Added bonus: My toddler loved the design, "Ohhh, sooo cuuuute."
customer_reviews.author: Hope C. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I do not like these. They don’t fit well and hold nothing so even one accident goes out the side and down the leg of my toddlers pants. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie G

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We use honest company diapers and love them but these feel nothing like them! They are not as soft and the sizing is awful! My daughter is long and thin... only 24 pounds and the 2t-3t are almost snug on her! She wears 18 month clothing and these diapers barley cover her bum! It says up to 34 pounds... I don’t see how that is possible. So so disappointed. I wanted to love these and stick with the company we love but we will be looking else where and are stuck with a bunch of pull ups that don’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna G.

customer_reviews.title: Good for us
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are not the greatest in absorbency, however we spend the extra money on these because they dont give our toddler a rash. She gets very bad rashes with diapers with chlorine. When she was a baby we used seventh generation but for some reason their training pants are not as good as the diapers. Now we used Earth's Best for night time and Honest for daytime, since Honest doesn't hold up that much liquid in them.
customer_reviews.author: G K

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed
customer_reviews.text: Been ordering honest co for 3 years. Ordered 3t training pants recieved newborn diapers... ordered again... got newborn diapers AGAIN. I'll just buy from Target from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try
customer_reviews.text: We are still in the process of potty training, I normally use pampers easy ups but due to the pandemic they’re sold out every where so I decided to try these. They aren’t the softest however they do absorb all the accidents in case your little can’t make it to the potty or you’re in the process like us. I do recommend like everyone else said by sizing down we are a 3t-4t in easy ups but the 2t-3t works well. The design is cute and she can maneuver and pull them up and down. We have super sensitive skin and no reactions. Definitely give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Jaren Greene

customer_reviews.title: New design is awful, leaks every night now for a week!
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying these for over a year now and they were great. Until the new design. Since we got the newer version, my son has leaked an soaked his bed every night now for a week. He wakes up in the middle of the night constantly now, when he never did before. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Gave my kiddo a rash and feel like plastic
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for potty training thinking they would be better than the typical pull-ups with their claim of "underwear like feel" but they are just like a regular diaper without the tabs on the side. My kiddo has woken up multiple times because these things make her backside sweat, resulting in her first series of diaper rashes. We've never had this issue with diapers (Pampers pure). We've since returned the surplus we had and have ordered cotton training pants for nighttime.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: Rash, rough and plastic feeling
customer_reviews.text: We use pull-up diapers at night for our potty learner and she is in panties the rest of the time. We usually use Naty and she is not prone to rashes. I was surprised to find that these honest pull-ups were rough and plastic-y in comparison, they also have a strange chemical smell. I noticed that soon after putting on the pull-up, my daughter would be sweaty underneath. She developed heat rash on her hips and bottom. Luckily the rash cleared up immediately as soon as we switched back to Naty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leak!!
customer_reviews.text: Leak like crazy!! I’ve cleaned up DIRTY diapers, clothes , and seats the last 3 times my daughter had to be in the car... overnights are a nightmare, and any activity makes pee and poo squish out the leg holes if not changed *immediately*. The pull ups practically fall off with the little bit of pee they do hold... Not excited about using up what we already bought!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Cooler version but “back” is difficult to find.
customer_reviews.text: Better version than the one on the right. It’s the same size but this fits better. Love that it is softer and thicker. The only complaint i have is that you can barely see the word “back.” They should’ve made it a little bigger and maybe not blend in the design. Overall it’s a good diaper.
customer_reviews.author: A.V.C.

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: These are, by far, our favorite training pants! We only use them at night, as my daughter has been potty trained for a long time now, but night training is a different story. We have never had a leak with these. They're cute and comfy. When I have tried other brands because of availability issues, my daughter has gotten a rash. But not with these. So I would say they are a good choice for a child with sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!!!! These are awful!!! Fall apart and gel explodes! Literally the WORST pull up EVER
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: We have just recently went from Size 5 diapers to these due to beginning potty training and these have been pretty good as far as easily being able to pull up and pull down when in a hurry to get to the potty. They obviously are not as absorbing as the diapers so we still use a diaper at night but for the purpose of a pull up, this serves its purpose. My toddler has only ever been able to use Honest brand diapers as she gets diaper rashes and chemical burns with others and the pull ups have been gentle on her as well. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Westemk

customer_reviews.title: Good eco-friendly alternative
customer_reviews.text: These work well. They are a little difficult for my toddler to pull up and down on his own because they roll up... but I think that is normal as they learn how. They are absorbent and don't seem to leak even with a lot of pee. These are just as good if not better than the big-name brands. And they cost the same. I don't understand why more people don't buy eco-friendly when the cost and quality are so comparable nowadays.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgett M. Blose

customer_reviews.title: Sides of diaper come undone too easily when pulling up and down to go potty.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I only buy The Honest Company Diapers and are loyal to the brand. So it came as a surprise to move to training pants for our toddler and have them not work very well. The absorbency is adequate and they hold up well in that regard. The issue is in training your toddler to pull them up and down, they come undone on the sides and then don't go back together well enough to keep using them. We usually just replace them at that point, even if there wasn't an accident. We bought the 104 ct so it will be a while before we burn through them as we switched to another brand of training pants.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Marshall Jr

customer_reviews.title: Not fitted at all
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these pull-ups and they generally are well-reviewed, but I found them to be awful. They have virtually no stretch, so once you get them on the child, they don't conform back to the body and gap away from the legs. The absorbent layer is also concentrated in one narrow area. Combined, these two features allow for shifting of the pull-up during use and leaks. I don't usually write reviews of products but, given the high rating of this product, I thought I should speak up to help other parents avoid disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Christina A. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: 1 OUT OF 4 PACKS WERE FAULTY!!!
customer_reviews.text: the unicorn 🦄 design is so awesome, they don’t leak, well unless she excessively drank but any pull up will leak quickly if ur child excessively drinks.. I 💯 love these more than huggies and pampers BUT out of the 4 packs I ordered an entire pack was JUNK I attempted to help her pull them up THE SIDE RIPPED OUT EVERYTIME!! I had these on auto order but if Honest Company doesn’t make things right I won’t waste my money again I’ll go back to the Pampers easy ups...All in all had I not ended up with a pile of ripped unused pull ups I would give them 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Runs small very narrow bottom
customer_reviews.text: These run small and are very narrow. My little one fits well within the recommended Weight range and these are still uncomfortable and small. They are not soft like the diapers and the butt area is very narrow causing her to get a wedgie constantly and therefore leaks. These are an absolute disappointment. I would return if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good training pants for a transition between diapers and underwear
customer_reviews.text: These have been great for potty training my son. He loves the fun rainbow unicorn print. They are really easy to take on and off, and clearly labelled as to which side is the back. They are not SUPER absorbent, so I would still recommend a diaper for overnight until your child is fully trained. But they really don't leak for minor accidents during the day. They are very soft, and my son seems to find them comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kayleigh B.

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent, Non-Toxi, Not bulky
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these! Have only maybe had one or two leaks at night but that's because they slipped a bit. That is primarily when we use them. And for activities as a "back-up plan". They are absorbent but not bulky so they are very comfortable for the girls to wear in their sports activities and can't tell they are wearing them at all.
customer_reviews.author: MillFactory

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, we usually get the target brand because the sides break away and are easier to get on and off but purchased these on a pinch. These are our go to now. Our daughter only wears them overnight and we've only had one leak all month! She's 2 1/2 and sleeps 11-12 hours in them with a cup before bed. Very happy with them
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Ford

customer_reviews.title: Way better than most pull ups
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE that these are looser around my daughter’s thighs. We tried huggies pull ups in the biggest size and they were still too small around her legs, these are the best I’ve found and wish I had sooner!!! Definitely worth the money! Also very absorbent.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffanie

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy, no Velcro but easy tear to remove
customer_reviews.text: Love these training pants. They don’t have Velcro on the side but they’re super easy to tear the side to remove. My son is about 32lb and can wear size 5 or 6 in huggies so I got the 2t/3T initially but I’m returning for the 3T/4T. We’ve always had great luck with honest diapers (I’m not a fan of their wipes tho) so we love that they’re available on Subscribe & Save!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I could care less that these are organic. Turns out that they aren't that soft. And they aren't the most absorbent pull up out there. But what I liked is that they are all the same pattern. Most other brands have mickey in there or something else my kid refuses to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Linsi

customer_reviews.title: Not Stretchy Enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my toddler was beginning to potty train and the scent of seemingly all other pull ups was overwhelming. However, I was disappointed in the stretch of these. They're really not stretchy at all. And with my petite daughter, they barely stayed up. The absorbency was fine. We only had one leak. I did appreciate the fact that they're unscented.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Prefer these in comparison to other choices
customer_reviews.text: I like how these fit and that they had a fun pattern on them, making them appealing to wear. They were soft and didn't leak, but most boxes had a chemical odor. I didn't smell it on the first couple of boxes, so perhaps they changed the way they are made. We switched brands because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Not very absorbent, too narrow
customer_reviews.text: These are too narrow to be a 2t/3t, one side often ends up in my toddlers butt cheek because they’re so narrow. So a child doing movement they run into the butt. What’s the result? Blowouts if child doesn’t make it to potty in time.
customer_reviews.author: Phil GoBeGreat

customer_reviews.title: Leak protection is not there.
customer_reviews.text: First, I love the prints. My son is obsessed with dinosaurs and this is perfect. Secondly, we have had a few leak accidents but I thought it was the way I put them on, perhaps with an active toddler, sometimes it's hard to put it in a perfect way. So I kept trying and last night was my last straw. After 3 hours of sleep, (again) I found my son was soaking wet. I changed him to a new diaper and pj's. 30 minutes later, I found him wet again on the side. Got up and changed again. My son was upset that I woke him up again and he didnt go back to sleep until 3 hours later.
customer_reviews.author: rachel lynch

customer_reviews.title: It is not made symmetrically.
customer_reviews.text: The training diapers are made of good materials however they leak. I didn’t know why my daughter always ended up wet pants every time she had those on. Now I think I found the reason. The diapers have some defects. They aren’t made symmetrically. One side for leg is definitely wider than the other. It is not just one diaper. It is each single one of them. So I will not buy these anymore even it is made of good material. It doesn’t serve for the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: yiyu & boyu

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy and uncomfortable NnnNzjkkskjxkdjxjs
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today. They’re so scratchy and stiff that I don’t even want to subject my son to them. I’m sorry I opened them, because I don’t think we will be using them. They feel terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Carl JenningsjkKl

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I tried to like Honest but their diapers SUCK. Both my girls got the worst rashes and the diapers were so rough and stiff. Don’t waste your money. If you want a natural diaper try Bambo or HelloBello! Both never once gave my girls a rash.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Rough scratchy and rashes
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible diaper. I love that it’s biodegradable and that’s about the best thing I can say about it. The material was like scratchy public restroom paper towels...but the main issue is that within a couple of days my daughter developed rashes! The photo I included is of her hip where the elastic touches her skin on both sides. I don’t know what is in these diapers but her skin really reacted to it! Maybe the absorbency just sucks and the moisture caused her skin to react. I’m not really sure. I won’t be using them again! I returned them yesterday I hope I get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ann b.

customer_reviews.title: Solid earth-friendly diapering alternative
customer_reviews.text: Cute designs. Reasonable price. I bought these because I wanted a more earth-friendly option for my son nighttime diapering. He is fully potty trained, so I can’t really speak to it’s effectiveness on that subject. However, I did notice that these pull-ups have leaked a couple times (doesn’t hold as much as Huggies training pull-ups). Overall, though, I’m satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Clark

customer_reviews.title: Not What’s Sold at Target
customer_reviews.text: The product on my picture on the left is the Honest Training Pants I bought 2 weeks ago at our Target. They fit great and my toddler loves them. On the right are the ones that came today from Amazon. They’re are so much bigger, feel less absorbent and are not a true size 2T/3T. I’m not sure which one is a newer version, but these are not what I expected based on what I bought in store and I’m definitely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Allison P.

customer_reviews.title: Too loose around skinny legs
customer_reviews.text: I love the brand and really wanted these to work for us. While these training pants are very absorbent, they were too loose around my son's leg to reliably hold in solid waste. We will use the rest for overnights since the absorbency is still impressive. For daytime use, these would work better for a child with chunky baby thighs or a child who is further along in potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Melitta

customer_reviews.title: Best pull ups!!
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the reviews saying the sides aren't elastic and run big. These people are being dramatic!! The sides are very stretchy. They are thinner compared to other major brands, but my 2 yr old has been using them for over a month (mostly during naps) the sides have not torn and he has not leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very cute pattern but the material is not soft.. my daughter is 3 years old, we ordered the 4t. We were very disappointed, because my daughter keeps pulling at the back of pull ups saying it’s stuck, just not very comfortable for her.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2-3t for our 18 month old, they do not fit properly. They barely cover the necessary areas and feel if she has a bowel movement in them it will not be contained making a large disgusting mess. Now we are stuck with 50$ worth of useless pullups.
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: They are not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my toddler, and don't like them: tearing easily (through away like 10 diapers because they ripped when was putting on), always one side is sticking in his little butt, not wide enough
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seem small and not stretchy. Good for allergies
customer_reviews.text: Somehow if you buy honest from target instead of here the quality is totally different. These seem tight and not stretchy compared. Also, at night doesn’t hold at all. For allergies, it’s a good pull up.
customer_reviews.author: Naty

customer_reviews.title: Not great for potty training but good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying all types of clean brands for my babygirl. These are great diapers good absorbency however they are a little stiff which looks a little uncomfortable. No leaks. They don’t go off easily enough for a toddler to pull down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would buy them again
customer_reviews.text: They work fairly well, would not recommend letting your little one fall asleep in them as the sides are absorbent and will sometimes leak. I like that they dont irritate his already sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.author: SBedford

customer_reviews.title: Not for overnight, heavy wetters.
customer_reviews.text: Not for overnight, heavy wetters. My two year old is potty trained throughout the day but still wets the bed at night. I bought these diapers, thinking they would be suitable to use with him, but it’s the second night and he’s soaked the bed both nights. Very disappointed... They also don’t fit snugly and “aren’t comfortable“.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Eh, difficult to pull up and down for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: My son is 2.5 y/o and 32 lbs. I ordered the 3t/4t size and it's very tight on him. It's too hard for him to pull up and down himself. Since we've used these, he's also gotten rashes on his hips. Prior to Honest, we've only used Pampers or Huggies pull-ups and he's never gotten rashes on his hips. The only pro for us is the construction pattern that my son loves.
customer_reviews.author: MSH

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy on the run
customer_reviews.text: My nephew is not fan of potty, so, don’t know how it goes with potty training. Speaking about its’ work, 5+ stars. You just put it on on the run. Easy peasy. Should have tried it long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jemal & Babajan

customer_reviews.title: Works for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Works well on my son't sensitive skin. Only drawback is when he has a poop accident it doesn't really contain it. It always comes up the back. Holds pee well though.
customer_reviews.author: digiproducer

customer_reviews.title: Elastic needs to be stronger for slimmer kids
customer_reviews.text: I like this brand but this pull up was slack at the waist. My daughter is tall but tiny...I think they need to add stronger elastic at the waist for slimmer toddlers. The leg elastic could be tighter too.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of the Honest brand but these are not made properly. The middle part is not big enough to cover anything and they don't even fit my 3 year old. I spend most of the day fixing the diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Villegas

customer_reviews.title: Sweaty bum
customer_reviews.text: It’s an ok diaper but I don’t like how it makes my son’s bum sweat. He always seen to be sweaty when I check his diaper. They seem to be absorbent enough and they are not bulky but don’t like that sweaty feel around his waist line and bum. Will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Large, loose and shapeless
customer_reviews.text: There is something wrong with what I received. These seemed stretched out and oddly big. Mind that we’ve been getting training pants size 2t from honest for a while. Something is wrong with this design model
customer_reviews.author: Belen

customer_reviews.title: Updated version is awful.
customer_reviews.text: We got a new version this time we ordered, as if they “updated” the product. This new version is trash. These used to be better than their overnight diapers in terms of overnight leaks. These don’t even stand up to naps. Every sleep we’ve used these for have resulted in leaks. These never leaked before they “updated” the product. It’s trash now and I’ll never purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand what the purpose of these training pants are?! They leak!!! My child went through multiple outfits and soaked through his bedding. These are not mom friendly, at all. Easy Ups by pampers are definitely the way to go bs these. Don’t even waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ellysa Luehrs

customer_reviews.title: Leaks, every time
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these very cute pull-ups. My son is potty trained, but uses a pull-up at night. He wore these three nights in a row and each night leaked through, everywhere. I gave up on these and went back to the pampers easy ups. Sorry Honest, wanted to love these, but just plain don’t work. And, the sides you have to permanently rip to get off, while the easy ups you can also ‘rip’ the sides but can be reattached together in case the pull up is dry to wear again.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like these!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these! The prints are super adorable & they fit my son so well! However, he got a rash from these, so we had to stop using them.
customer_reviews.author: Kali C.

customer_reviews.title: Great thin pull up
customer_reviews.text: Love the pint and the fact that they were really thin (we used cloth up until this point). Too bad the toddler diaper rashed on the side of her booty so we discontinued and the rash went away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: My kid is allergic to almost every pull up I’ve tried but these! She loves to pick out the patterns for the next bundle and I love that they’re easy for her to put on and off herself
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Curtin

customer_reviews.title: Bought these on sale actually really like them
customer_reviews.text: They seem to absorb more and fit better around the waist and legs I got 3t-4t for my 27 month old son and they fit fine. Love the material and designs. I will consider splurging for these instead of pull ups.
customer_reviews.author: jujumama

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely reorder for future use.
customer_reviews.text: These are really good training pants. However they seem to run big. My grandson wear a size 2t and these are a little big on him. I wish they were more snug. But, they are overall great training pants.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri L.

customer_reviews.title: Winner for sure
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleasantly surprised by these!! They are definitely more training pants than pull ups, but they really hold a lot!! Life got in the way of our potty training even tho I was so dead set on it that I had bought these instead of more diapers! Haha and they have been doing the job amazingly! So thrilled! AND on top of that they’re super cute & better for my babes butt!? Winning!
customer_reviews.author: Tim K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!!  Love them. Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: I love the stretchIness and how dry it keeps him. One of the few brands that his sensitive skin can handle. When he has a rash that wasn’t diaper /brand related they were my go to so I just completely switched! I love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy_mogul

customer_reviews.title: Tearaway but not velcro
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be easy for putting them on.. it just is easy to tear away. Still have to take off shoes and pants for these to put on new ones. Cute design though
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Cute designs, rough texture, not that absorbing and they are not big enough for my daughter to cover her butt, even went up a size
customer_reviews.author: Yoly Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Fun design, but stiff diaper
customer_reviews.text: Fun design, but the diaper is pretty stiff, so not my son's favorite. It doesn't tear while getting it on, which is nice, but there's just so many other pullups that are softer/stretchier/comfier (even 'green ones' that are similarly priced)
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Great for allergy prone skin
customer_reviews.text: These are the only brand pull ups my little one can use due to allergy tendencies and skin irritations. Just wish they came in bigger size. Leak protection good, would probably be better if I could get bigger size to fit better...
customer_reviews.author: chilirojo

customer_reviews.title: worst rash
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited trying these diapers on my toddler: cute print + going GREEN. It turned out to be a nightmare! I tried the first diaper on him last night and this morning he woke up with the worst rash I have seen. We've never had this problem before and now, because It's very, V-E-R-Y, bad, I have to take him to his pediatrician. So, instead of going GREEN, we'll going to pediatrician....
customer_reviews.author: NatBos

customer_reviews.title: Thin but absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Nice training pants for my almost 33 month old. We’ve had a few successes in the potty, although not with #2 yet. But overall the diapers are fun and thin enough that it’s not too itchy for him to wear during the day and at night. I thought the sizing might be too big but he grows in spurts so the (up to 34lbs) might be useful depending on how long the little guy resists using the potty...
customer_reviews.author: Le-Tokars

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great pull up, easy to pull apart to take off, super terrible absorbency. Like down the leg while it was on. Cute tho
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Jameson

customer_reviews.title: The only brand to consider
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper/pull up brand for newborns-toddlers. Keeps them dry , cute designs that get them excited. Also , worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is allergic to other diapers and training pants. We have used Honest company for over 30 months. We have been extremely happy.
customer_reviews.author: #BeHonest

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: These fit my little one well without being bulky and diaper shaped. She's potty trained in the day and we didn't want her nighttime pull up to feel or look like a diaper. This is a nice in between.
customer_reviews.author: Apryl Yearout

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Honest diaper standards! Cause Rashes!
customer_reviews.text: My son has very sensitive skin and regular Honest diapers are the only type he can typically wear. With that being said, these are not up to par with their typical diapers. They gave my son a rash on both of his sides where the white sides of the training pants touched his skin. I will be finding other training pants.
customer_reviews.author: Dan & Lindsey Loyson

customer_reviews.title: Not the real Honest Brand Pull-ups
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I had been buying one pack versions at the store and wanted to have a lot on hand. When they arrived I had just ran out of pull-ups. These were NOT the ones I have been purchasing from the store. They DO NOT have the same fit or absorbency. I’ve already used two due to lack of diapers in the house otherwise I would be returning. DO NOT purchase these if your wanting real honest brand pull-ups.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Knockoff
customer_reviews.text: These are not the same AT ALL as the ones sold in stores. I don’t know if it’s a knock off brand or what but do not buy these, save your time money and frustration and stick to ones in store or through their website. We’ve been using honest diapers/training pants for years and have never had an issue. Recognized immediately that the thickness, quality and materials are not the same as the ones we know and love.
customer_reviews.author: Sad Mama

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these training pants but I have been really disappointed. My son developed a rash on his bottom after switching to this product from Huggies training pants, plus they leaked on multiple occasions. On a positive note the dinosaur design was very cute, but overall I am not impressed and have 3 more packs of these training pants that we won't be using.
customer_reviews.author: Katie B

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Huggies pullups
customer_reviews.text: They feel uncomfortable and nothing like underwear so they don’t really help in potty training. They also don’t absorb much so leakage happens.
customer_reviews.author: Todd G

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality.
customer_reviews.text: the cheapest dispers we have dried. Dont hold up over night. Feel flimsy. Sides rip away too easy. Earth and Eden are far better quality.
customer_reviews.author: victoria

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: The stretchy part is extremely thin and weak. Awkward to put on and take off. Not a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Night time sleepers
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears these to bed - we love the patterns - and haven’t had any accidents.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Keller

customer_reviews.title: Fit well and holds in liquids and solids
customer_reviews.text: These stretch in all the right places. They are absorbent and fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Wisefield

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful designs and they rarely leak!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this pull ups just as much as we did the diapers, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Poison oak effect!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst training diapers I ever tried. It literally burned my baby’s skin who never had any skin issue, zero diaper rash since he was born. All the strechy parts irritated his skin so bad. Never ever buy it again! I don’t understand what they put in that strechy part, poison oak?
customer_reviews.author: Sahika

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and rashes :(
customer_reviews.text: Keeps leaking through the night. My 2yo is almost potty trained so I always make sure he uses potty before he goes to sleep but it just keeps leaking. Plus he’s getting rashes on his butt cheeks and it’s really bad. We still have three more bags left. Totally waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Keiko Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: The diapers do not have a clear front and back. Both sides are universal, thus their rear end coverage is very lacking. I’m constantly having to fix my daughter’s diaper. The absorbency is awful. I haven’t had this many pee and poop blowouts since she was under 3 months. I’m very disappointed. Definitely won’t be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite brand of training pants.
customer_reviews.text: We love these training pants. Perfect solution for sensitive bottoms potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Casey K

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY brand for latex allergies!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter developed a latex allergy which took a month of purchasing several brands of diapers/pull-ups to figure out. After losing my mind (and my money) we finally found that the Honest Co. training pants were the ONLY brand my daughter could use. Even other organic brands still gave her an allergic reaction.
customer_reviews.author: AutumnH

customer_reviews.title: WORST RASH EVER
customer_reviews.text: The WORST diaper I have bought in my life! How can an environmentally aware compny cam produce such a product. I gave my 4 year old son a total front rash . UNBELIEVABLE!!!! Never buy it!
customer_reviews.author: SULE ZORLU

customer_reviews.title: Best pull ups
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wore 7th gen diapers but when we got to pull ups, we switched to Honest as they work better
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Leaks everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Everytime my child pees it goes right out of the leg holes. The fit is too large and it's the same size we buy in any other brand. I find myself doing even more laundry because my child leaks everywhere. Save your money. I wanted to be eco friendly but these training pants are just no good.
customer_reviews.author: Zenaida Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Cute but ok diaper.
customer_reviews.text: Cute diaper. My son likes it. But absorbing is not that great and sometimes leaks too...
customer_reviews.author: Eric M.

customer_reviews.title: They too thin
customer_reviews.text: This are really expensive and they not work so disappointed
customer_reviews.author: silvia ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality. They absorb really good, even at night.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Gazley

customer_reviews.title: Worst training pants ever
customer_reviews.text: I tried these because they had decent reviews. I was a little hesitant when I opened the box because they didn't seem like they would hold much in them. To no surprise they didn't. When my now 2 year old goes she really goes. These Training pants had no chance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because there was a coupon. My grandson was so excited to have dinosaur pull-ups.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Farooqui

product_meta.title: The Honest Company Toddler Training Pants | Fairies | 3T/4T | 92 Count | Eco-Friendly | Underwear-Like Fit | Stretchy Waistband & Tearaway Sides | Perfect for Potty Training
product_meta.description: Size:3T/4T (92 Count)| Pattern Name:FairiesPremium eco-friendly, disposable training pants with a cloth-like feel and contoured fit. Perfect for potty training, our training pants are ultra thin, ultra absorbent, and ultra adorable!
feature_bullets: UNDERWEAR LIKE FIT: Super-soft inner and outer layers provide a comfortable, big-kid undies feel
EASY ON + OFF: Soft and stretchy all-around waistband creates a flexible fit and makes it easy for your toddler to use on their own
SECURE LEAK PROTECTION: Day and Night Comfort + Protection
Liquid-locking core and secure-fitting moisture barrier cuffs help prevent leaks — just in case
ECO-FRIENDLY & SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS: Bio-based core with sustainably harvested fluff pulp and plant-derived materials
OUR HONEST PURPOSE: The Honest Company was born of a simple purpose: to create safe, effective products for our families and yours

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
